intro: Galium verum var. brebissonii, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
